text.div:
BC ReferenceRange Logical Model

The usual or acceptable range for a test result.

name: ReferenceRange
title: BC ReferenceRange Logical Model
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC).
description: The usual or acceptable range for a test result.

element.definition: The usual or acceptable range for a test result.

element.short: Range representing the usual or acceptable range for a test result.
element.definition: Range representing the usual or acceptable range for a test result.

element.short: The most specific code (lowest level term) describing the kind or sort of thing being represented.
element.definition: The most specific code (lowest level term) describing the kind or sort of thing being represented.

element.short: Code representing the most specific code (lowest level term) describing the kind or sort of thing being represented.
element.definition: Code representing the most specific code (lowest level term) describing the kind or sort of thing being represented.

element.short: Codes to indicate the target population this reference range applies to. For example, a reference range may be based on the normal population or a particular sex or race.
element.definition: Codes to indicate the target population this reference range applies to. For example, a reference range may be based on the normal population or a particular sex or race.

element.short: The age at which this reference range is applicable. This is a neonatal age (e.g. number of weeks at term) if the meaning says so.
element.definition: The age at which this reference range is applicable. This is a neonatal age (e.g. number of weeks at term) if the meaning says so.
